newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico Cetes rate dips at close after quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: Mexico Cetes rate dips at close after quiet trade.

text.p: Mexico's overnight Cetes rate closed down 20 basis points on Thursday after a slow session in which liquidity predominated, traders said.
"Volume was very thin, and dealers just made what trades they had to in order to leave early," a dealer said.

"Although changes were small, rates did tend to fall. The cutoff date (for banks settling checking acounts with the central bank) is out of the way, and with a lack of traders, rates will tend to fall further," he added.
Overnight rates on bank paper meanwhile closed unchanged at 29.00 percent.
Banks had to settle balances outstanding with the central bank on Tuesday.
Traders said they foresaw more sessions hallmarked by thin volume and light dealing until at least the New Year.
"The forex market and the bourse are quiet, too. Every one has covered positions," a trader said.
Banco de Mexico offset liquidity shortfalls by auctioning four credits for a total of 5.408 billion pesos, which it assigned at rates of between 28.68 and 28.70 percent.
Total credit maturities for Friday were estimated at 6.235 billion pesos.
